intro: Tulipa samarica, commonly known as the Samarkand tulip, is a species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its bulbs are adapted to survive harsh winters, allowing it to bloom in early spring. The foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge after the flowers have faded.
